author: AFP
title: NASA unveils probe bound for Jupiter's possibly life-sustaining moon - Hindustan Times
text: NASA unveils probe bound for Jupiter's possibly life-sustaining moon NASA unveils probe bound for Jupiter's possibly life-sustaining moon US space scientists on Thursday unveiled the interplanetary probe NASA plans to send to one of Jupiter's icy moons as part of humanity's hunt for extra-terrestrial life. The Clipper spacecraft is due to blast off in October bound for Europa, one of dozens of moons orbiting the Solar System's biggest planet, and the nearest spot in our celestial neighborhood that could offer a perch for life. [Explore now!](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket?utm_source=middlearticle&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=crickitlaunch) "One of the fundamental questions that NASA wants to understand is, are we alone in the cosmos?" Bob Pappalardo, the mission's project scientist told AFP. "If we were to find the conditions for life, and then someday actually find life in a place like Europa, then that would say in our own solar system there are two examples of life: Earth and Europa. "That would be huge for understanding how common life might be throughout the universe." The $5 billion probe is currently at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in California, sitting in a "clean room" a sealed area only accessible to people wearing head-to-toe covering. The precautions are to ensure the probe remains free of contaminants to avoid transporting Earthly microbes to Europa. After transport to Kennedy Space Center in Florida, Clipper is set to launch aboard a Space X Falcon Heavy rocket and begin an over-five-year journey that involves a pass by Mars to pick up speed. In 2031, it should be in orbit around Jupiter and Europa, where it will begin a detailed study of the moon scientists believe is covered in frozen water. "We have instruments like cameras, and spectrometers, a magnetometer and a radar that can... penetrate right through ice, bounce off liquid water and back to the surface to tell us how thick is the ice and where is liquid water located," Pappalardo said. Mission managers do not expect to find little green men swimming in the water in fact, they're not even looking for life itself, only for the conditions that could support it. Scientists know from extreme environments on Earth like light-starved geothermal vents located deep under the polar ice cap that tiny beings can find purchase almost anywhere. And conditions on Europa, which is almost as large as Earth's moon, could provide a similar habitat, offering the tantalizing prospect we are not alone not even in our own Solar System. "If moons around planets far away from stars could hold life, then the number of opportunities around the solar system, around the universe, where life could take hold, I think goes up dramatically," said Jordan Evans, project manager for the Europa Clipper mission. The science is not easy a powerful radiation field around Europa could degrade the instruments, which will be getting the equivalent of 100,000 chest x-rays every circuit around the moon. The vast distances involved mean that when Clipper sends its data back, the signal will take 45 minutes to arrive at Mission Control. And despite its massive solar array, which unfurls once in space, keeping Clipper powered will be a major challenge, Evans said. "Right after launch, putting out 23,000 watts... but when we're out at Jupiter, so far away from the Sun, they're only putting out 700 watts," he said. "Near Earth, they could power 20 houses continuously. And when we're at Jupiter, just a few light bulbs and some small appliances." The mission, planning for which began in the late 1990s, is expected to conclude around 2034, when Clipper will likely have reached the end of its useful life. The probe will then have one final port of call: Jupiter's largest moon, deputy project manager Tim Larson said. "After we're done with the science mission, the way we end is by crashing into one of the other bodies in the Jovian system to dispose of the spacecraft," he said. "Right now, the plan is to go into Ganymede." hg/des This article was generated from an automated news agency feed without modifications to text. [Login Now!](https://accounts.hindustantimes.com/?type=plain&ref=ht&funnel_entry=end_of_article&cta=end_of_article&is_premium=false)

author: 上海证券报·中国证券网
title: 创新金融服务 推动"科技-产业-金融"良性循环
text:
今年政府工作报告提出，“推动科技创新和产业创新融合发展”“完善科技金融、绿色金融、普惠金融、养老金融、数字金融标准体系和基础制度”。
　　紧跟科技创新和产业升级的步伐，金融机构作为服务科技企业的“主力军”，积极探索“科技—产业—金融”深度融合发展，创新金融服务和信贷产品，让金融“活水”流入产业发展的“良田”之中。
　　 从实验室到产业化
　　 促进科技创新和产业创新深度融合
　　金融是推动科技创新的“燃料”，是促进科技成果转化的中介、驱动高质量发展的引擎。银行业正在通过创新金融服务，推动“科技—产业—金融”良性循环。
　　在上海杨浦，一家科创板上市公司的科技成果正在从实验室走向产业化。从通信大数据行程卡，到如今便民惠民的“沪惠保”，再到一些城市的政务系统，均有这家云服务公司的赋能。“科技企业高速发展，离不开金融支持。”该公司董事长说。
　　金融加持，让科技企业专利变“红利”，实现创新成果“落地生金”。“我们投放了5000万元知识产权质押融资贷款，用于企业日常经营周转，帮助企业实现科研成果转化。” 兴业银行 （ 601166 ）上海闸北支行行长王吉中说。
　　兴业银行上海分行战略客户部总经理佘雅琼向上海证券报记者表示，接下来该行会继续围绕产业链精耕细作，探索可复制、高效优质的创新服务模式，帮助科技企业解决痛点难题、创造更大价值。金融机构应持续优化资源配置、创新金融服务，打通堵点、连接断点，促进科技创新和产业创新深度融合。
　　日前，金融监管总局、科技部、国家发展改革委联合发布《银行业保险业科技金融高质量发展实施方案》（以下简称《实施方案》），从加强科技金融服务机制等方面提出措施，推动科技创新和产业创新深度融合，支持“科技—产业—金融”良性循环。
　　上海金融与发展实验室首席专家、主任曾刚表示，这有助于增加金融资源对科技创新的供给，畅通科技资金循环，促进科创产业融合，提升金融服务的精准性、高效性，推动银行业保险业科技金融高质量发展，助力实现高水平科技自立自强。
　　 从方案到落地
　　 科技金融政策试点有序推进
　　在推动“科技—产业—金融”良性循环的总体考虑下，科技金融相关政策试点也正在有序推进。
　　并购是科技企业做大做强的关键一招。近期，金融监管总局组织开展适度放宽科技企业并购贷款政策试点工作。记者了解到，多家银行落实最新政策，为科技型企业并购提高贷款比例、拉长贷款期限，帮助其快速完成收购目标资产，缓解短期资金压力。
　　“我们收到试点工作通知后，第一时间组建了专业团队，深入研究政策要点，制定试点工作细则，充分发挥并购金融产品体系优势，为科技型企业量身打造‘融智+融资’全链条并购金融服务方案。”交行投资银行部业务专家表示。
　　该业务专家表示，其团队刚刚为某民营集成电路EDA企业并购交易发放一笔8年期并购贷款。并购方与标的企业专注于国产集成电路EDA研发服务，本次收购后，并购方将进一步强化产业链整合，完善国产EDA生态版图。
　　“这笔试点业务贷款期限的延长，缓解了科技企业成长初期资金回笼慢、流动性需求高的难点，为企业持续投入研发、扩大生产提供了稳定的资金保障。”交行公司机构业务部相关处室负责人告诉记者，该行正在迅速对接集成电路、生物医药、新材料和高端装备制造等各类优质科技企业，后续将按照监管要求完成投放。
　　《实施方案》还明确，将金融资产投资公司（AIC）股权投资试点，有序扩大至具备经济实力较强、科技企业数量较多、研发投入量较大、股权投资活跃等条件的地区，支持符合条件的商业银行发起设立金融资产投资公司。
　　目前有工银投资、农银投资、中银资产、建信投资、交银投资5家AIC，分别由5家国有大行全资设立于2017年。记者注意到，近期， 招商银行 （ 600036 ）和兴业银行相继表态，将积极准备和研究论证设立AIC。业内人士认为，在政策支持和引导下，未来将有更多银行设立AIC。
　　 从融资到生态
　　 提供“金融+非金融”综合化服务
　　如今，越来越多金融机构加快科技金融生态圈体系建设，根据企业需求，为科技型企业提供综合金融服务。
　　浙江海宁经济开发区自2016年起大力推进泛半导体产业发展，但鉴于半导体产业专业性强等特点，园区内科技型企业授信复杂度高、且企业综合需求难以得到满足。
　　银行通过“金融顾问”服务模式，解决企业发展过程中遇到的各类问题。“我们通过人才贷、科创银投贷、科创共担贷等科技金融特色产品破解中早期科技型企业评审难题。同时，提供供应链金融服务，帮助科技型企业实现了降本增效。” 浙商银行 （ 601916 ）人士说。
　　“企业有时缺钱，有时缺资源，因此，金融机构要在企业成长的不同阶段、用不同的方式去支持，为企业提供长期的陪伴式服务。”浙商银行公司银行部副总经理李林认为。
　　金融支持科技型企业，要做到既融资、又“融智”。“金融服务上，我们打造了覆盖企业初创期、成长期、成熟期的综合金融服务；‘非金融’服务上，我们着力于满足科技型企业在科技系统、研究咨询、产业对接等方面的需求，通过建立行业专家库、深耕‘区域+行业’研究等方式，充当科技型企业的移动智库。”佘雅琼说。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: The Editorial Board
title: Samoa Observer | Medicine shortage can be prevented
text:
The Ministry of Health needs to overhaul its procurement of medicine and medical supplies for public hospitals. The number of medications and chemicals in short supply is alarming and poses a risk to the public.
It is worrying that there is a temporary disruption in biochemistry testing across various medical wards and clinics within the main hospitals and district hospitals in Upolu and Savai'i.
The restriction, highlighted in a Memorandum dated 18 February 2025, limits routine biochemistry tests to only the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) and the Emergency Department (ED) due to a critical shortage of necessary reagents.
This means that important tests to successfully diagnose ailments are not at the disposal of the hard-working medical staff. In addition to the biochemistry reagent shortage, a list of available medicine supplies reveals that other critical medications are currently out of stock across the nation’s health facilities.
The shortage of these reagents vital for conducting biochemical tests is causing significant challenges for clinicians.
As of 17 February 2025, 14 oral tablets and capsules are completely unavailable, and some of these items have been flagged as "long-term out of stock." Among the most concerning shortages are medicines such as ibuprofen (400mg), with only the 200mg formulation available. The next expected delivery for these supplies is 5 March 2025.
For injectable medications, 37 are out of stock, including adrenaline 1MG/ML, which is crucial for life-saving resuscitation efforts. Amoxicillin + Clavulanic acid (Augmentin) 1.2g for injection, another essential medication, is also unavailable.
Additionally, six oral liquid formulations are out of stock, and seven topical products are unavailable.
Another pressing concern is the shortage of ipratropium bromide 20 mcg inhalers, which are used for managing chronic respiratory conditions such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and emphysema. Didn’t the MOH declare a whooping cough outbreak? Children are still presenting themselves to the hospital with the symptoms.
Additionally, 13 eye, ear, and nose products are reported to be out of stock, further exacerbating the strain on the nation’s healthcare system. The medications and chemicals are essential for effectively diagnosing cases and not having them in stock is a worry.
A larger number of people cannot access private doctors because of affordability. That is the reason why many will wait endlessly at the hospital to see doctors and attain their subsidised medication. The government, in this case, the MOH must ensure that medications are always available and hospitals can carry out tests whenever needed.
This situation in no way shows improvements in the public health system. Improving health services is part of every election promise, this shows how much effort has been used to fulfilling that promise.
Hospital and pharmacy inventory management is a complex but critical process within the healthcare delivery system. Without adequate pharmacy inventory management practices, hospitals run the risk of not being able to provide patients with the most appropriate medication when it is most needed.
That is what we are witnessing unfold. It could not be anyone’s fault just a need to review the processes and adapt one that will always ensure that there is medications and chemicals needed for labs are always in stock.
There are many reasons why hospitals are not always able to get certain medicines. This may include when manufacturers can have problems with making the medicine, transporting the medicines or there are problems with sourcing the ingredients needed to make the medicines. The current situation we are facing has been blamed on delayed shipment. That is why an effective inventory or procurement system is needed.
The shortage of medicine in hospitals and failure to conduct necessary tests could become the difference between life and death. The people need better healthcare. Plan wisely and stock medicines and chemicals better.
Surely, there are enough funds to procure enough supplies. There should be no reason why so many medications are unavailable. If doctor and nurse shortages cannot be fixed instantly, the least that can be done is to have enough medicines.
